<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tshrjn>@tshrjn</denchmark-link> behind the scenes we're using Plotly to convert the matplotlib object into an interactive chart. If you wrap your matplotlib object in we'll instead render out a png which should be exactly what you see in a notebook context. You can also generate Plotly charts directly which should give your more control over the final rendering. Regarding the step slider, currently we only support the internal step counter to move across time. Can you share a little more about your usecase with custom x-axis values?
Is there a way to use the step slider with Plotly charts? Also, a use case for step-slider is similar to that of the x-axis available in the workspace for instance, epoch instead of a step.
Yep, if you call wandb.log multiple times the step slider will be available for plotly charts. We'll add a +1 to custom x-axis for media panels.
